channel.title: math.AC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On minimal free resolutions of the cover ideals of clique-whiskered graphs
item.description: arXiv:2505.04248v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We explicitly construct a minimal free resolution of the cover ideals of clique-whiskered graphs. In particular, Cohen--Macaulay chordal graphs, clique corona graphs, and Cohen--Macaulay Cameron--Walker graphs are examples of clique-whiskered graphs. We also introduce multi-clique-whiskered graphs as a generalization of both clique-whiskered graphs and multi-whisker graphs. We prove that multi-clique-whiskered graphs are vertex decomposable and hence sequentially Cohen--Macaulay. Moreover, we provide formulas for the projective dimension and the Castelnuovo--Mumford regularity of their edge ideals. Finally, we construct minimal free resolutions of the cover ideals of both multi-clique-whiskered graphs and very well-covered graphs.
item.dc:creator: Yuji Muta, Naoki Terai

item.title: Derived characterizations for rational pairs \`{a} la Schwede-Takagi and Koll\'{a}r-Kov\'{a}cs
item.description: arXiv:2501.02783v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Our work establishes derived characterizations for notions of rational pairs \`{a} la Schwede--Takagi and Koll\'{a}r--Kov\'{a}cs. We use a concept of generation in triangulated categories, introduced by Bondal and Van den Bergh, to study these classes of singularities for pairs. Specifically, we characterize these two classes of singularities for pairs solely through categorical properties. This shows that the `natural morphisms' central to defining such singularities are intrinsically linked to the structure for the derived category of a variety.
item.dc:creator: Pat Lank, Peter McDonald, Sridhar Venkatesh
